New Records: The 130-run stand between Engelbrecht and van Beek is the highest partnership for the seventh wicket or lower at a men's ODI World Cup, going past Kapil Dev and Syed Kirmani's unbeaten 126-run stand in 1983.
Key Match Events: Sri Lanka won by 5 wickets with 10 balls remaining.
Pathum Nissanka scored his third consecutive half-century.
Aryan Dutt took 3 wickets for the Netherlands.
Kasun Rajitha and Dilshan Madushanka both registered career-best figures, picking four wickets each.
Sybrand Engelbrecht and Logan van Beek's 130-run partnership helped Netherlands post a competitive total.
Dushmantha Hemantha finished the game with a boundary for Sri Lanka.
Pre-Game Insights: Sri Lanka made two changes to their side, bringing in Dushan Hemantha and Kasun Rajitha.
Netherlands were unchanged from their previous game against South Africa.
Post-Match Reflections: Samarawickrama mentioned that the wicket was gripping and turning, and Sri Lanka planned to take the chase deep.
Scott Edwards praised Engelbrecht and van Beek for their rescue job and Aryan Dutt for his efforts.
Kusal Mendis expressed happiness with everyone's contributions to the win.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Netherlands' 262 is their highest total against Sri Lanka, surpassing the 258 scored in 2006.
Sri Lanka's win marked their first victory in this World Cup after three consecutive defeats.
This was the first time Sri Lanka had lost their first three games in a World Cup since 1987.
